intro: Sedum takasui, commonly known as the Takasui stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Japan. It is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Sedum takasui is drought-tolerant and requires minimal maintenance once established.
